title: 107_s3099
content:
The Act titled "Emergency Agricultural Disaster Assistance Act of 2002" provides crop disaster assistance. The Emergency Agricultural Disaster Assistance Act of 2002 authorizes the Secretary of Agriculture to provide emergency financial assistance to producers who have suffered qualifying crop losses in 2001 or 2002 due to damaging weather conditions. Assistance will be administered similarly to previous legislation, with the same loss thresholds for quantity and quality losses. Crop Insurance: The Secretary must not discriminate or penalize producers who have purchased crop insurance under the Federal Crop Insurance Act. SEC. 3. LIVESTOCK ASSISTANCE PROGRAM: The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to provide payments for livestock losses in counties designated as emergencies for 2001 or 2002. Part of the funds will be allocated to the American Indian livestock program. Assistance will be administered similarly to section 806 of the Agriculture, Rural Development, Food and Drug Administration, and Related Agencies Appropriations Act, 2001.

SEC. 4. FUNDING. SEC. 4. FUNDING. The Secretary will use funds from the Commodity Credit Corporation to carry out the Act and transfer an amount to section 32 of the Act of August 24, 1935 for disaster assistance to crop and livestock producers for losses in 2001 and 2002. SEC. 5. REGULATIONS. The Secretary may issue necessary regulations without following certain provisions. SEC. 6. EMERGENCY DESIGNATION. SEC. 6. EMERGENCY DESIGNATION. The President must submit an official budget request designating the entire amount as an emergency requirement. Congress designates the amount as an emergency requirement under specific sections of the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985. SEC. 7. BUDGETARY TREATMENT. The provisions of this Act that would impact direct spending or receipts under the Balanced Budget and Emergency Deficit Control Act of 1985 will be treated as such.
